intro: Mikania hagei, commonly known as the smallleaf morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Its flowers typically open in the morning, giving it the common name "morning glory." Mikania hagei is often used in ornamental gardening but can become invasive in certain environments.
